revised_title: Exploring the Circulation of Blood in Vermes and Its Significance
tldr: The author examines the circulation of blood in Vermes, a class of animals, and discovers that their circulation is reversed compared to higher classes of animals. This unique circulation allows Vermes to survive in a torpid state and reanimate when conditions are favorable. The author also discusses the different orders within the Vermes class and their distinct methods of aeration and circulation.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Animal Physiology
